intro: Meyerophytum meyeri, commonly known as the Meyer's meyerophytum, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender stems and small, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
